title: Particle motion from x(t) part - b

content.description: A particle starts at time t=0 and moves along the x-axis so that its position at any time t ≥ 0 is given by x(t)=(t−1)3(2t−3) .
content.question: For what values of t is the velocity of the particle less than zero?

frqParts.text: For what values of t is the velocity of the particle less than zero?

topic.text: 4.2: Straight-Line Motion - Connecting Position, Velocity, and Acceleration

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
